009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle.geometric;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static java.lang.Math.hypot;
013import static org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory.evaluationChecker;
014
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresFactory;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresOptimizer.Optimum;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LeastSquaresProblem;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.fitting.leastsquares.MultivariateJacobianFunction;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
028import org.apache.commons.math3.optim.SimpleVectorValueChecker;
029import org.apache.commons.math3.util.Pair;
030
031import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
032import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
033
034/**
035 * <p>
036 * "Distance-based" geometric circle fitter using a nonlinear least-squares
037 * (Levenberg-Marquart) optimizer. See [1, Sec. 11.1.3] for a detailed
038 * description (Alg. 11.3).
039 * </p>
040 * <p>
041 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
042 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
043 * </p>
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 * @version 2022/11/17
047 */
048public class CircleFitGeometricDist implements CircleFitGeometric {
049        
050        public static final int DefaultMaxIterations = 1000;
051        public static final double DefaultTolerance = 1e-6;
052        
053        private final Pnt2d[] pts;
054        private final double[] V;
055        private final double[][] J;
056        private final Optimum solution;
057        private final List<double[]> history = new LinkedList<>();
058        
059        public CircleFitGeometricDist(Pnt2d[] pts, GeometricCircle initCircle) {
060                this(pts, initCircle, DefaultMaxIterations, DefaultMaxIterations, DefaultTolerance);
061        }
062        
063        public CircleFitGeometricDist(Pnt2d[] pts, GeometricCircle initCircle, int maxEvaluations, int maxIterations, double tolerance) {
064                this.pts = pts;
065                this.V = new double[pts.length];
066                this.J = new double[pts.length][3];
067                
068                LeastSquaresProblem problem = 
069                                LeastSquaresFactory.create(
070                                        new AnalyticModel(), // model(V, J), 
071                                        new ArrayRealVector(pts.length),                // zero vector
072                                        new ArrayRealVector(initCircle.getParameters()),
073                                        evaluationChecker(new SimpleVectorValueChecker(tolerance, tolerance)),
074                                        maxEvaluations, maxIterations);
075                
076                LeastSquaresOptimizer optimizer = new LevenbergMarquardtOptimizer();    // new GaussNewtonOptimizer();  
077                this.solution = optimizer.optimize(problem);
078        }
079        
080
081        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
082
083        @Override
084        public double[] getParameters() {
085                return solution.getPoint().toArray();
086        }
087        
088        @Override
089        public int getIterations() {
090                return solution.getIterations();
091        }
092        
093        @Override
094        public List<double[]> getHistory() {
095                return history;
096        }
097        
098        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
099    
100    /**
101     * Defines function {@link #value(RealVector)} which returns
102     * the vector of model values and the associated Jacobian matrix
103     * for a given parameter point.
104     */
105    class AnalyticModel implements MultivariateJacobianFunction {
106
107                @Override
108                public Pair<RealVector, RealMatrix> value(RealVector point) {
109                        final double[] p = point.toArray();
110                        if (RecordHistory) {
111                                history.add(p.clone());
112                        }
113                        
114                        final double xc = p[0], yc = p[1], r  = p[2];
115                        for (int i = 0; i < pts.length; i++) {
116                                double dx = xc - pts[i].getX();
117                                double dy = yc - pts[i].getY();
118                                double ri = hypot(dx, dy);
119                                
120                                // values:
121                                V[i] = ri - r;
122                                
123                                // Jacobian:
124                                if (isZero(ri)) {       // (xi,yi) is at the circle center
125                                        J[i][0] = 0;    // (xc - xi) = 0 too
126                                        J[i][1] = 0;    // (yc - yi) = 0 too
127                                } else {
128                                        J[i][0] = dx / ri;
129                                        J[i][1] = dy / ri;
130                                }
131                                J[i][2] = -1;
132                        }
133                        RealVector VV = new ArrayRealVector(V, false);
134                        RealMatrix JJ = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(J, false);
135                        return new Pair<>(VV, JJ);
136                }
137        
138    }
139    
140    
141    
142    // -------------------------------------------------------------------

188}
